content.description: This is a fun mixed line that starts out on a slab and climbs up to some steep jugs.  It is reachy.
content.protection: Bolts and a #0.3 Camalot.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb a thin hands/hands splitter up to a ledge at ~10 feet.  From the ledge, continue up a fun, steep, pocketed slab passing three bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a #2 Camalot.
content.location:
This is right of

Mass Wasting

by ~50 feet.

content.description:
Start at a big hold ~7 feet off the deck with a severe undercut where the paleosol has eroded away.  Clip a high bolt (easier from the right side of the large hold), work your feet up, and deadpoint to a big hold.  Keep it tight as you bump your feet up and clip another bolt.  Work your way onto a sloping ledge and onto a water-streaked headwall.  Clip 2 more bolts on the headwall before reaching the chains.

So fun!
content.protection: 4 bolts.  You can easily stick-clip the 2nd bolt to avoid a potential groundfall.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb an easy, thin hands crack up to a roof, traverse left, and pull a fun move to gain a steep, right-facing corner.  Climb the corner via laybacking and face to a 15 foot, horizontal, hands roof.  Undercling or jam out the roof with good feet and continue up via hands and wide hands over one more small roof to the anchor.
content.protection: Tips through wide hands (extra wide hands), long slings.  2 bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on the wall, see the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: This route climbs a steep face with fun and interesting movement.  It has atypical climbing for the wall.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is just right of

Punctuated Equilibrium

.

content.description: This is a great, bouldery route that houses 4 roofs.  Face climb and layback a left-facing corner up to a good undercling crack that takes hand-sized gear.  Stem up and clip a bolt before making some interesting body tension moves to gain another undercling (crux).  Layback the undercling and move right to gain a sloping arete and a decent rest.  Pull up into the fat fingers roof (#0.5 Camalot), and square up for the next fingers roof (#0.4 Camalot).  Above the fingers roof you are rewarded with some big jugs and a mellow headwall to the chains.
content.protection: In order:  gold Camalot, quickdraw, 0.5 cam, 0.4 cam, and optional hand-sized piece above.  Slings.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Climb a sloping block to a good stance and clip a bolt.  Move up and left on good holds, throw for an obvious positive rail, and clip another bolt.  Undercling and thumbstack a flared pod to gain another jug.  Clip a bolt and follow pockets up the arete to chains passing 1 more bolt.
content.protection:
4 bolts.  This shares an anchor with

Paleomagnetism

.
content.location:
It is left of

Diagenesis

~35 feet.

content.description: Climb a left-facing corner that takes 00 and 000 C3s up to a good hold on the top of a pillar.  Hand traverse to the right to mount the pillar, and continue up a pocketed face to the anchor.
content.protection: 00-000 C3s and 1 bolt to a 2 bolt anchor.  An orange Metolius TCU would also fit in the corner.
content.location:
This is ~15' left of

Diagenesis

.

content.description: Climb a fun compression and stemming corner up to a roof and make a big reach to a splitter and a great hand jam.  Fall into the hand jam and climb the jugs above to the chains.
content.protection: Purple Metolius, doubles of #0.5 Camalots (one for a pod high in the corner and one right below the roof), and a red Metolius at the lip of the roof.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description:
Climb steep face and a less than tips flake (green C3) to a good finger lock.  Layback up to a right-facing corner that widens from hands to 5" and tapers back down to thin hands.

The bottom is thin and sporty, and the upper corner is cruiser with a lot of good stemming.
content.protection:
Green C3 through 5". This shares an anchor with

Punctuated Equilibrium

.
content.location:
This route is right of

Ultramafic

~50 feet.

content.description: Climb a slot with a tips crack in the back and face up to a ledge, and follow discontinuous cracks to the chains.
content.protection: Tips though green Camalot.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: I bolted the TR anchors for this and ran out of time to finish it.  Make some tricky moves off the deck to gain a slabby, right-facing corner that leads to a roof.  Pull through the improbable roof and the climbing eases above.
content.protection: 2 bolt TR anchor.  The route will probably need at least one bolt at the roof.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: This route begins in a small, right-facing corner.  Climb the fun corner up to a roof that takes finger-sized gear.  Pull the roof, and climb the steep face above passing 2 bolts.  It could be a bit harder for short people.
content.protection: Red C3, #0.4 Camalot, 2 bolts, and slings.
content.location: This is the right-most route on the wall, directly above the gully with the fixed rope.

content.description: Begin by pulling a bouldery roof crux right off the deck.  Once established on the face, continue up steep jugs to some mellower climber before the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is just right of

Ultramafic

.

content.description: Climb a steep face up to a good hold and clip a bolt.  Make a big reach or dead point to a ledge.  Hump your way onto the ledge and stem up to another bolt.  Pull over the mini-roof on a 2 finger pocket, reach out left to a jug, and follow pockets to the chains passing another bolt.
content.protection: Bolts.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: A bouldery start leads to easier climbing up to a steep section with a good, left-trending rail.  Pass the rail, and continue up via good pockets to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts and an optional 1.0-1.5" piece between the 1st and 2nd bolts.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the wall.

content.description: Climb a funky slot up to a juggy horn, and pull around a roof on a finger lock to gain a hand jam.  Clip a bolt above and continue up face to the anchor.
content.protection: Tips through 2.5", 1 QD.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Begin up a slab and move right to a #2 Camalot placement in a horizontal crack.  Pull up into a good stance on large holds and plug in some micro-cams.  Continue up the steep, black water streak with big reaches between good holds passing 2 bolts.
content.protection: C3s, #2 Camalot, and 2 bolts.
content.location:
This is just right of

Mass Wasting

.

content.description: Climb onto a ledge above the paleosol and into a flare.  Make big reaches between steep jugs past a bulge and finish up a slab to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is right of

Xenolith

by ~20 feet.

content.description: Climb a fun, slabby wall with good holds passing three bolts.
content.protection: Three bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is left of

Day Old Mackerel

.

climbs.name: Get Crazy With the Cheese Wiz

content.description: Begin at a severe undercut where the paleosol has eroded away, and pull up on big jugs to get established on the face.  Once established, follow a thin crack up through big holds, work left, and face climb past 2 bolts.
content.protection: A #0.4 Camalot protects the opening moves, C3s above and an optional hand-sized piece, and 2 bolts.
content.location:
This is left of

Babies Have Rabies

on the right side of the wall.

content.description: Begin on a featured arete, and clip a bolt before arriving at a small ledge.  From the ledge, plug in a #0.5 Camalot high over your head, climb the flake up to a good stance, and clip another bolt before arriving at the anchor.
content.protection: 2 bolts and a #0.5 Camalot.  If you're short, bring a micro-cam like a #00 C3 or equivalent.
content.location:
This route is just right of

Paleoflow

.

content.description:
Climb the 1st 8 feet of

Cheese Wiz

, and continue up and left following a thin crack to a small ledge.  From the small ledge, clip a bolt, and make some reachy moves with bad feet to gain another small ledge.  Clip another bolt, and continue up on big holds to the chains.
content.protection: #0.4 Camalot protects the opening moves, C3s and an optional hand-sized piece after the 2nd bolt.
content.location:
This is right of

Diagenesis

~50 feet.

content.description: Climb a hand crack up to a bulge, and continue up on face with good gear to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Thin fingers through hands.
content.location:
It is right of

Xenolith

.

content.description: Climb face up an arete to fun pockets below the chains.
content.protection:
Per

Jared Nelson

: 3 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: This is a short sport route that begins in a steep corner and climbs through a bulging arete.
content.protection: 2 bolts and an optional green C3 between the 1st and 2nd bolt.
content.location:
This route is immediately left of

Xenolith

.

content.description: A reachy start leads to a bolt at a bulge.  Pass the bulge on the right, and continue up a slab with big holds.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is right of

German on 2nd

.

content.description:
This route is a variation of

Topographic Reversal

.

Climb the 1st 35 feet of

Topographic Reversal

up to the hands roof, and traverse left using a tips crack (red C3) and slabby feet to a 1.0-1.5" splitter through the roof.  The splitter protects well with #0.5 Camalots.  Work your feet up, reach out to an unlikely jug at the lip of the roof, and climb the jugs above to a 2 bolt anchor.  This might feel a little stiff if you're short.
content.protection: Tips through green Camalot.
content.location:
This route shares its start with

Topographic Reversal

on the left side of the wall.  See the beta photo on the main page.

content.description: Begin in a hand crack with an undercut, and climb to the top of a large block and nice ledge.  From the ledge, continue up steepish face with good holds passing 2 bolts.
content.protection: Hand-sized gear, 2 bolts, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is just left of

Vesicle Joyride

.

content.description: Begin climbing in a low-angle flare that steepens to a good stance.  Plug in some small cams, and pull onto a pillar below a pocketed face.  Climb pockets and edges to the chains.
content.protection: 3 bolts, red C3 or #00 Friend, and a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is between

Pull the Trigger

and

Diagenesis

.
